Game2

Class Game2

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
      • Game2.Game2
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class Game2
extends java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
    Game2 is a game where the goal is to clean the shipping boats before they reach the docks, as dirty boats reaching port will bring along invasive species that will upset the natural balance of the surrounding estuary
    Version:
    5/17
    Author:
    Team 7

    • Method Detail

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        When the mouse button is pressed, sets mousedown to true and sets mx/my to the mouse's x and y position. If the mouse was over the quit button when pressed, reset the game.
        Specified by:
        mousePressed in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Overrides:
        mousePressed in class java.awt.event.MouseAdapter

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        When the mouse button is released, sets mousedown to false.
        Specified by:
        mouseReleased in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        Overrides:
        mouseReleased in class java.awt.event.MouseAdapter

      • updateBoat

        void updateBoat(int index)
        Updates a boat from the ArrayList of gameObjects. If boat is active, call move method. If boat is clicked on, set isInfested to false
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the object in the ArrayList

      • updateBoats

        void updateBoats()
        Iterates through the array of GameObjects, pulling each boat. If the boat made it to the left side of the screen and is active, print y velocity and set isActive to false. If the boat is also infested, subtract 1 from Lives. If lives is 0, reset the game. If the boat didn't make it but is active, checks to see if mouse was clicked over boat position, if so set isInfested to false, then calls the move method.

      • addBoat

        public void addBoat()
        Takes a random number (0-6) and assigns r to it and y to 0. if there are less than 35 objects in the array of GameObjects, r equals another random integer (0-6) and, depending of the fullness of each dock, assigns the y value of the new boat to line up with the specified dock. Makes the new boat with all of the variables and adds it to the array of GameObjects. If objects is equal to 35, call the resetGame method

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Handles the methods called every tick of the game. Increments the counter and adds a new boat, increases the speed, or decreases the boatspeed and sets mx/my to 0, depending on the value of the counter.

      • getObjects

        public java.util.ArrayList<gameObject> getObjects()

      • mouseOver

        boolean mouseOver(int mx,
                  int my,
                  int x,
                  int y,
                  int width,
                  int height)
        Checks to see if the mouse is over given coordinates on the screen.
        Parameters:
        mx - Mouse x-position
        my - Mouse y-position
        x - x-position of image being checked against mouse x-position
        y - y-position of image being checked against mouse y-position
        width - Width of image being checked for mouse over
        height - Height of image being checked for mouse over
        Returns:
        Returns true if mouse is over given image position, false if otherwise

      • resetGame

        void resetGame()
        Resets Game2 by setting game values back to starting values, clearing the ArrayList, and setting gameState back to Menu.
